summary: This bill, the Patent Eligibility Restoration Act of 2025, aims to amend Title 35 of the United States Code to clarify and broaden the scope of patent eligibility. It seeks to eliminate judicial exceptions to patentability and defines which inventions can be patented including processes, machines, manufactures, and compositions of matter while also specifying certain exclusions like unmodified human genes and certain process types. The bill also introduces new definitions and guidelines for determining patent eligibility and includes provisions regarding infringement actions and rules of construction.
